title.narrative: Tanzania Country Programme. Good Governance and Human Rights

description.narrative: The Governance and Rights Programme 2016-21 will contribute to the promotion of democracy, good governance, rule of law and respect for human rights with a special focus on women. The theory of change for the programme is based on the assumption that democratic, transparent and accountable governance where women’s rights are equal to men’s provides the most fertile ground for economic development and eradication of poverty and inequality. Strengthening of demand-side governance will contribute to stronger institutional checks and balances, empower citizens, and enhance the potential impact of Danish support provided to Government. In the short-term, change is expected in terms of a stronger and more vocal civil society, increasingly demanding transparency and responsive governance from duty bearers, as well as an increased access to justice for women and men. A particular change is expected in terms of increased awareness of and respect for women’s rights.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Gender is mainstreamed in all functions of the National Assembly.
Number of oversight and selected sectoral committees demonstrate the capacity and commitment to conduct gender analysis and mainstream gender into policies and bills of the parliament.

target.value: At least 3 oversight committee develop and implement action plans to scrutinize policies, programmes and budget and their impact positively on gender equality

actual.value: 3 oversight committees have managed to develop and implement action plans to scrutinize policies, programmes and budget and their impact positively on gender equality

target.value: Committees have limited capacity to conduct gender responsive analysis

actual.value: Committees have limited capacity to conduct gender responsive analysis

target.value: At least 2 oversight committees develop & implement an action plan to scrutinize policies and programmes and their impact on gender equality

actual.value: Gender strategy and action plan approved in 2019. The sectoral committees – budget, infrastructure development, agriculture, water and livestock were trained on gender mainstreaming worked on two bills. The bills Land Transport Regulatory Authority Bill49 and the Water Supply and Sanitation Bill.

target.value: Capacity building support for relevant committees in gender mainstreaming and analysis conducted

actual.value: Six committees were provided with capacity support on gender mainstreaming and influenced bills on water and sanitation and PPP amendment bills.

target.value: NA supported to conduct an assessment/review/evaluation of institutional structure operations and procedures of the NA to influence gender sensitive reforms in the NA

actual.value: The gender assessment of the National Assembly was conducted in 2017. The final report is expected primo 2018.

target.value: At least 2 oversight committee develops & implements an action plan to scrutinize policies and programmes and their impact positively on gender equality

actual.value: The project supported the development of a gender mainstreaming guidelines to ensure that the commitments within the gender mainstreaming strategy and the handbook are attained. - The project supported validation and approval of the Gender Mainstreaming Handbook for which UN Women provided the technical input for developing the manual.

title.narrative: Increase the capacity of National Assembly to effectively scrutinise legislation and to monitor government performance in a participatory manner through inviting public hearings
Increased percentage of CSOs, Academia, Research institutions that participate and engage in the work of the National Assembly

target.value: 12 sectoral committees have been oriented with relevant scrutiny guidelines and use the knowledge to conduct an evidence based detailed review of Bills

actual.value: 12 sectoral committees have been oriented with relevant scrutiny guidelines and use the knowledge to conduct an evidence based detailed review of Bills

target.value: At least 4 committees supported under Output 1 development & implements an action plan for broad public consultations. including. where appropriate. field visits. to engage citizens and CSOs; Database of relevant CSOs for committee work is developed; At least 1 committee supported under Output 1 develops & implements an action plan for engagement of marginalised groups. including relevant CSOs

- At least 4 committees have developed action plans for broad public consultations - Database for CSOs maintained - At least 2 committee have developed an action plan for engagement of marginalised groups.

actual.value: In 2018. 23 consultations were made on various bills presented to parliament using guidelines and database developed in 2017. Recommendations made by CSOs led to amendments of at least five bills. CSOs representing marginalised groups were included in the 23 consultations.

target.value: At least 4 committees supported under Output 1 develop & implement an action plan for broad public consultations. including. where appropriate. field visits. to engage citizens and CSOs; Database of relevant CSOs for committee work is maintained; At least 3 committees supported under Output 1 develop & implement an action plan for engagement of marginalised groups. including relevant CSOs

actual.value: In 2019, 6 committees developed action plans for public consultations using the guidelines prepared. Also, the project improved the accessibility of marginalised groups granting support to CSO’s engagement with committees.

target.value: - At least 4 committees have developed action plans for broad public consultations - Database for CSOs maintained - At least 3 committee identified in 1.1 & 1.2 have developed an action plan for engagement of marginalised groups.

actual.value: The CSO database has 124 organisations and coalitions. A similar database has also been developed for independent experts and researchers in areas such as gender (including mainstreaming and budgeting); public finance management; legislative drafting; monitoring SDGs.
